title: Quiz 7: Family & Education Institutions
description: Assess your knowledge of the family unit, its functions, and the role of education in society.

questions.question: Which type of family consists only of parents and their children?
questions.explanation: The nuclear family is the core unit of parents and children.

questions.question: According to George Peter Murdock, what are the four PRIMARY functions of the family? (Select four)
questions.explanation: Murdock identified sexual, economic, reproductive, and educational functions as primary.

questions.question: Match the kinship term to its definition:

pairs.right: People descended from a common ancestor (blood)
People who become kin through marriage

questions.explanation: Cognatic = Blood; Affinal = Marriage; Extended = Generations.

questions.question: ___BLANK___ education is acquired through formally established institutions, while ___BLANK___ education takes place in places like the home or workplace.
questions.explanation: Formal education is institutional (schools). Informal is experiential.

questions.question: Which function of education involves transforming a heterogeneous community into one bound by a common language and identity?
questions.explanation: Social integration binds diverse people together through shared culture/language.

questions.question: The 'Custodial Function' of schools refers to teaching children how to clean the environment.
questions.explanation: Custodial function refers to 'taking charge' or caring for children while parents work, not cleaning.

questions.question: What is the 'Selection and Allocation' function of education?

options.text: Screening students and determining their future occupation/status

questions.explanation: Schools screen abilities and allocate students to future roles/statuses based on performance.

questions.question: What term describes the family into which a person is born?
questions.explanation: Family of orientation is where you are born/raised. Family of procreation is where you marry/have kids.
questions.hint: Where you get your 'orientation' in life.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a function of the family?
questions.explanation: Enforcing national laws is a function of the government/political institution, not the family.

questions.question: Education is a lifelong process that begins as soon as a child is conceived.
questions.explanation: Education/learning is continuous from the very beginning of life.
